Topic.Title: Hate Board

Message.Msg: Flattered. Thanks. No I don't write for a living. I just get inspired by the bloviating windbags on here who think regurgitating onto a Yahoo message board whatever Hannity or Limbaugh said today is the same as having an original thought. Additionally, since almost all of them are retired (from God knows what) they make retirement look massively depressing and to be avoided at all costs: sitting in the basement all day listening to Fox news and henpecking onto a keyboard a misspelled, syntactically perverse rendition of their best recollection of what they thought they heard. Gotta run - dinner in Yountville at the French Laundry tonight!

Message.Title: Hedging a $100k position in T
Message.Msg: As of today's close, these were the optimal puts to hedge T against a greater-than-21% drop between now and January 18th: https://twitter.com/PortfolioArmor/status/240229107365994496 The cost as a percentage of position was only 0.87% at the ask (in practice, you could have probably purchased these puts for a little less -- at some price between the bid and ask).

Topic.Title: Paul Ryan is Trending #1 now on searches

Message.Msg: >>>>Since when did the government do business better than private companies? When Fedex agrees to send junk mail anywhere in the country for $0.49 an envelope, you can b**** about the post office. In the meantime, keep your mouth shut or pony up $20 bucks every time you need to pay a bill. Really. Do you think the post office is designed to be profitable? Do you think it is a good business model to send a person to every address in America six-days a week for free? Yet somehow the electric company got paid every month, and your SS check shows up too. No problem. Still you people do nothing but complain. The charge too much for stamps. You think AT&T's service is better than than the post office? Get real! Nattering nabobs of negativism.

Topic.Title: Paul Ryan is Trending #1 now on searches

Message.Msg: >>>To make us competitive with the rest of the World will require that the minimum wage be lowered to $1.00 per hour. Obama is not interested in making us competitive, he wants to make us subservient. $1.00 an hour? To me, it sounds like you want to make us competitive by making us subservient. Those are the chains Joe Biden was talking about. That's not acceptable. Your idea of a market economy is one where the people serve corporations to make them profitable. My idea of a market economy is where corporations serve the people by efficiently distributing goods and services. I think like an economist. You think like a robber baron.

Topic.Title: Paul Ryan is Trending #1 now on searches

Message.Msg: >>>Colorado university study predicts an Obama loss. Well, that's one. It's notable that this one is based entirely on economic indicators--not any polls--and on economic levels, not trends. Since Bush caused the recession and trends have been good, polls have tracked higher for Obama than pure economic levels would suggest. EVERY election predictor that includes poll numbers (including those with economic indicators) predict an Obama win.
